fields.night_curfew: Yes, strict departure restrictions for jet engines from apron between 10:15 PM and 6:00 AM local time. Exceptions for pre-approved medical evacuation flights. Stage 2 aircraft operations restricted between 11:30 PM and 6:15 AM.
fields.curfew_start_utc: 22:15 local time (for jet engine departures from apron), 23:30 local time (for Stage 2 aircraft operations)
fields.curfew_end_utc: 06:00 local time (for jet engine departures from apron), 06:15 local time (for Stage 2 aircraft operations)
fields.weekend_restrictions: Not explicitly mentioned, but implied by daily curfew.

operational_hours.risk_impact: High - flights outside hours will be cancelled

fields.slot_controlled: No (does not require airport slots for private and business jet operations)
fields.peak_congestion_times: Not explicitly mentioned, but it becomes slot-coordinated during major events (e.g., World Rugby Cup 2023, Summer Olympic Games 2024).

slot_requirements.risk_impact: High - delays common at slot-controlled airports

fields.fog_prone: Yes, significant factor affecting operations. Low Visibility Procedures (LVPs) implemented when visibility drops below 1,500 meters, leading to delays.
fields.snow_closure_frequency: Vulnerable to snow and ice, necessitating de-icing and snow removal, causing operational delays. Runway clearing takes 15-35 minutes.
fields.requires_cat_ii_iii_capability: Not explicitly mentioned, but modern aircraft with auto-land systems can handle low-visibility landings.

weather_vulnerability.risk_impact: High - weather is leading cause of delays

fields.minimum_runway_length_meters: Not explicitly mentioned, but 'capable of accommodating various aircraft types, including light, midsize, and large jets.'

fields.special_crew_training_required: Yes, for VIP/corporate jets, experience in corporate flying, adaptability, VIP catering skills.
fields.cat_ii_iii_rating_required: Not explicitly mentioned, but modern aircraft with auto-land systems can handle low-visibility landings.
fields.language_proficiency: Fluency in English often mandatory, French highly desired.
fields.certifications_medical: Valid European Cabin Crew Attestation (CCA) and Class 2 Cabin Crew medical certificate for cabin crew.
fields.documentation: Valid passport, visa (if applicable), licenses, medical certificates, crew ID, up-to-date vaccinations. General Declaration (Gendec) and passenger manifest for all flights.
fields.location_accessibility: Paris-based or willing to relocate, ability to reach Le Bourget within specified timeframe (e.g., 60 minutes).

fields.handler_availability_24_7: Implied by 24-hour arrivals and numerous FBOs.
fields.customs_hours: On-site customs and immigration clearance. Hours not specified.

fields.peak_hour_delays_typical: Not specified, but 'significant hub' and '55,751 aircraft movements annually'.

fields.noise_category_required: ICAO Annex 16 Chapter 16 acoustic certificate required for French metropolitan airfields.
fields.chapter_requirements: Chapter 2 aircraft banned for night-time flights.
fields.noise_surcharges: Not explicitly mentioned, but fines for non-compliance.
fields.preferred_departure_routes: Specific runway usage modalities, e.g., Runway 07 for jet-engined aircraft during certain night hours.
fields.noise_complaints_risk: High, due to strict enforcement and monitoring by ACNUSA.
fields.nighttime_restrictions: Jet aircraft generally prohibited from taking off between 10:15 PM and 6:00 AM local time. Landings restricted between 11:30 PM and 6:15 AM local time. Exceptions for sanitary, emergency, government flights.
fields.engine_run_up_apu_restrictions: Ban on engine testing between 10:00 PM and 6:00 AM (possible exemptions 10-11 PM and 5-6 AM). Limit APU use.
fields.take_off_procedures: Pilots select climbing procedures to reach 3000 feet AAL rapidly, reducing to noise abatement thrust at 700 feet AAL.
fields.landing_procedures: Pilots maintain last assigned altitude by ATC until intercepting ILS glide path. Final approach without flying below glide path.
fields.reverse_thrust_restrictions: Only permitted between 9:15 PM and 5:00 AM (winter) or 8:15 PM and 4:00 AM (summer) for security.

fields.maintenance_closure_days_annual: Runway 03/21 underwent significant refurbishment in 2020. Proactive maintenance.
fields.historical_closure_incidents: Most recent major event cited was Air France Flight 4590 in 2000 (attempted diversion). Incidents typically involve specific aircraft operations, not widespread infrastructure failures.
fields.maintenance_providers: Over 60 firms specializing in aircraft maintenance, equipment, and airport services.
fields.safety_management_systems: Implements Safety Management Systems (SMS) aligned with ICAO guidelines.

infrastructure_reliability.risk_impact: Low - rare but high impact events

fields.passenger_background_check_required: Not explicitly mentioned, but border controls verify ID against databases.
fields.liquids_gels_aerosols_restrictions: Limited to 100ml per container, in a single transparent, sealed bag (max 1 liter).
fields.electronic_devices_metal_objects_removal: Must be removed from cabin baggage and placed in separate trays.
fields.medicines_baby_food_inspection: Must be presented separately for inspection.
fields.border_controls: All individuals entering/leaving Schengen Area must show ID for verification. Biometric passports can use PARAFE. EU Entry/Exit System for non-EU nationals.
fields.prohibited_items: Knives, sharp objects, firearms, cartridges, ammunition, liquids/aerosols > 100ml.
fields.slot_landing_permits: Slot approval mandatory for all arrivals/departures. Landing permit required for all international charter/private flights.
fields.airport_access_badges: Required for airside access (TCA). Involves application, security awareness, business operations permit.
fields.ramp_driving_permits: Required for driving in airside areas (permis T).
fields.aircraft_security_search: Required before departure to check for prohibited articles, performed by cockpit crew, form submitted to ground handler.

fields.high_season_months: Not explicitly mentioned, but major events like the Paris Air Show (odd-numbered years), World Rugby Cup (Sept 2023), and Summer Olympic Games (2024) cause increased traffic and slot coordination.
fields.parking_limitations: Temporary limitations during major events (e.g., Paris Air Show). Hangar space reduced in winter.
fields.atc_system_implementation: Ongoing implementation of new 4-flight ATC system impacts slot coordination.

fields.nearest_suitable_alternate_code: CDG (Paris Charles de Gaulle), ORY (Paris Orly), POX (Pontoise – Cormeilles aerodrome), TNF (Toussus Le Noble Airport), BVA (Beauvais), LIL (Lille Lesquin), CRL (Charleroi).
fields.distance_to_alternate_km: CDG: 13.1 km, ORY: 23.3 km, POX: 33 km, TNF: 34 km, BVA: 59 km, LIL: 188.5 km.
fields.alternate_typically_available: Not explicitly mentioned, but the presence of multiple nearby airports suggests good availability.
fields.ground_transport_time_to_alternate_minut: CRL: 3 hours 7 minutes. Others not specified.

payment_and_fees.description: Financial arrangements that may cause delays

fields.advance_payment_required: Not explicitly mentioned, but implied that charter companies handle this.
fields.landing_fees: Based on MTOW and noise level coefficient (varies by time of day). Example: Group 1 aircraft landing at night (€4.000), day/evening (€1.300).
fields.parking_fees: Based on duration, MTOW, and parking area type. Example: €3.834 per MTOW ton for active parking areas (CDG/Orly, implied similar for LBG).
fields.discounts: 50% for helicopters, 50% for positioning flights between Paris-Orly/CDG and LBG, 75% for training flights. No fees for test flights/emergency landings.
fields.additional_services_cost: Influenced by aircraft type, flight duration/distance, departure location, availability, and additional services (VIP, ground transport).
